days.overview: Paul declares that God's will is your sanctification. Sanctification—being set apart for God and made holy—is central to God's purpose for believers.
days.reflection: What is sanctification? How is it God's will for you? What does being set apart mean?
days.prayer: Ask God to sanctify you completely according to His will.

days.overview: The author declares believers have been sanctified through the offering of Jesus Christ's body once for all. Sanctification is accomplished through Christ's sacrifice.
days.reflection: How were you sanctified? What did Christ's sacrifice accomplish? How is sanctification both accomplished and ongoing?
days.prayer: Thank Jesus for sanctifying you through His once-for-all sacrifice.

days.overview: Paul thanks God for choosing believers for salvation through sanctification by the Spirit and belief in the truth. The Spirit works sanctification in those who believe.
days.reflection: What is the Spirit's role in sanctification? How does belief in truth sanctify? How do you cooperate with the Spirit's work?
days.prayer: Thank God for choosing you and ask the Spirit to continue His sanctifying work.

days.overview: Paul instructs believers to present their members as slaves to righteousness leading to sanctification. Sanctification requires active presentation of ourselves to God.
days.reflection: What does presenting yourself to righteousness mean? How is sanctification progressive? What areas need to be presented to God?
days.prayer: Present yourself fully to God as a slave to righteousness leading to sanctification.

days.overview: Paul urges believers to cleanse themselves from every defilement of body and spirit, bringing holiness to completion in the fear of God.
days.reflection: What defilements need cleansing? How do you bring holiness to completion? What role does fear of God play?
days.prayer: Ask God to cleanse you from all defilement and complete your sanctification.

days.overview: Jesus prays for His disciples: 'Sanctify them in the truth; your word is truth.' God's Word is the means by which believers are sanctified.
days.reflection: How does God's Word sanctify you? What truth is transforming you? How much time do you spend in the Word?
days.prayer: Ask God to sanctify you through His Word and help you treasure it.

days.overview: Paul prays that the God of peace would sanctify believers completely—spirit, soul, and body—kept blameless until Christ's coming. He who calls is faithful and will do it.
days.reflection: What does complete sanctification mean? How is God faithful to sanctify you? What hope does this give?
days.prayer: Trust God's faithfulness to sanctify you completely until Christ returns.
